title: Someone please explain how I misplayed so severely for my team to get obliterated
body:
As Lux, I did the most damage on my team by a small margin, took the least damage on my team by a huge margin, had the most CC by a huge margin, and did quite a bit of shielding. Compared to me, the enemy team's Lux had double my champ damage, 1/3rd my shielding, 30% less damage taken, and 50% more CC.

And my team wasn't even bad, as far as I could tell. We didn't do anything ridiculous, made some good plays, and yet we got nowhere while the enemy team just rolled over us. Where the hell did we go wrong? Usually I can see that some poor plays resulted in a snowball, or we got to sudden death which is basically a coin flip, but this time I'm just confused.

https://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2947897564/219822320?tab=overview

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_xsxRESffiA

I did exactly that a few times, but Lux isn't Mundo. Taking some damage is unavoidable and occasionally beneficial, but pointing at a Lux's low damage taken as a _bad_ sign?

I mean if you consistently find yourself taking the least on your team or in the game then yes. It just shows that you are content with sitting pretty far back and throwing out spells, even if you could walk maybe a bit further up and get much more value abilities. I mean, if you’re trying to carry. Play around enemy cooldowns, you are not _always_ in threat of being one shot. That’s just bullshit. Even ADCs are able to flash forward when key cooldowns are down to take out priority targets. 

This isn’t something that you can learn from a YouTube video or something , you need to play games and look for opportunities and take them. Eventually you will realize your limits and improve. Playing super passive won’t accomplish shit. Doing the most damage doesn’t mean anything because you’re doing “low value” damage. Hitting full HP tanks or squishies when it doesn’t accomplish anything is low value (no tower damage, no objectives from the poke, etc). Flash, double Q on their carries, 1-shotting them, and then dying is better than sitting back and maybe just losing the teamfight but surviving. This kind of killer instinct takes time to develop.
